intro: Malouetia heudelotii, commonly known as the African wild cherry, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces small, red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It is often found in open woodlands and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
